description: From Latin antidotum, from Ancient Greek ἀντίδοτον (antídoton), neuter of ἀντίδοτος (antídotos, “given as a remedy for”), from ἀντιδίδωμι (antidídōmi, “I give in return, repay”), from ἀντί (antí, “against”) + δίδωμι (dídōmi, “I give”). Compare French antidote.

entries.meaning: A remedy to counteract the effects of poison.
examples: Synonyms: mithridatic, alexipharmic, alexipharmac, alexipharmacum, alexiteric, alexitery, treacle, theriac
She reached the hospital in time to receive the antidote for the snake venom.

entries.meaning: (figurative) Something that counteracts or prevents something harmful.
examples: We need an antidote for this misinformation.

verbs.description: antidote (third-person singular simple present antidotes, present participle antidoting, simple past and past participle antidoted)

examples: For his part, the patient must avoid some commonplace substances in order to avoid antidoting or stopping the action of the homeopathic remedy […]
